description:
Ultimate farm and vineyard package- Former Winery Clunes
The appeal and scope this property offers those seeking the ultimate tree change with its picturesque views of Mount Beckworth and the Great Dividing Range will entice one to explore further the opportunity on offer here.
Formerly the Mount Beckworth winery, this property is set on 32 cleared acres with approx. 10 acres planted with established cool climate vines, producing award winning wines, consisting of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Shiraz, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, ideal for a steady income whilst grazing of stock to supplement the lifestyle getaway.
With Clunes situated only 6 kms away, which has great infrastructure and amenities, this comfortable home offers 3 bedrooms with 2-way bathroom and large walk in robe to master with direct access to the large rear deck to take in the views off the 2nd and 3rd bedrooms while a central kitchen has access to the combined lounge and dining areas and separate family room with gas log heating.
Externally the shedding is superb with 3 bay machinery sheds, 20x40 each, with power and concrete floor and former cellar door with heating and cooling, ideal as rumpus or teenage getaway. A large substantial dam provides irrigation to vines and stock while ample tanks supply domestic water. Well situated to Ballarat and historic Clunes as well as other wineries, this property is well worth the viewing to take in the sights and breathe in your new wine getaway.
Call now to arrange your viewing

Wonderful Charm with Views Back Over Town
This delightful weatherboard home could be the perfect first home or even a warm abode for the retiree. The residence is solid and spacious and although it has seen much love, it still has the potential for someone to make it their own. Room sizes throughout are very generous taking larger suites in the living room, while the wonderful natural light is captured all day long. There are lovely views looking back to the hub of town and the 800m2 allotment grants the owner space for extension, shedding and further gardens. Just a one minute drive or a three minute walk has you in the heart of this historic and charming township. Enjoy all that the town has to offer from great coffee to informative walking tracks.

20 Acre Bush Block with grazing options
Zoned Farming, this property comes with an with option to purchase an extra 40 acres on opposite side of the track. Good grazing as well as bush setting with dam. Unserviced

Luxury Living at Golf Course Resort
This grand home on the RACV Goldfields Resort Estate is situated on a large landscaped garden allotment. The house overlooks a series of ornamental ponds at the entrance to the estate and abuts the 18 hole golf course. The lifestyle on offer is relaxing, with abundant native bird and wildlife within a facility. Enjoy golf, established mountain bike tracks, tennis courts and family BBQ facilities. The resort complex offers superb dining in a semi bush setting with access to Creswick's burgeoning village life. The spa town of Daylesford is only 25 minutes. Architect designed, the home is grandly styled with vast proportions giving an instant feeling of freedom and space throughout. Formal lounge, dining and casual living zones all face north, capturing great natural light with picturesque views over a large pond. There is a separate fitted home office, large games room and a huge master bedroom with room for a parent's retreat. Golfers, a buggy room is available adjacent to the oversized double garage.

Superb Family Home on 61 Acres backing onto Adekate Creek
Escape the hustle and bustle of the city life, escape to gorgeous district of Dean, where distant views and country life is combined with peace, quiet and serenity. Located just 10 minutes from the thriving township of Creswick, 20 minutes to Ballarat and approx. 75 minutes west of Melbourne, this 61.75 acres of mainly grazing land is supported by a sweeping country home, sheds and delightful gardens. Fronting onto the majestic Goldfields trail the property boasts five dams, service laneways to multiple paddocks and the benefit of Adekate Creek to the rear is just a few of the features of this magnificent property.
Elongated in design with full wrap around bullnose verandas, this country home offers enormous dimensions, with three generous living rooms, a corner kitchen, two bathrooms, independent laundry and three good size bedrooms. The master suite is pampered by a large walk in robe, plus a light bright ensuite with separate toilet for added privacy. Polished timber floors are present in the family room, which also provides a combustion wood heater and a large bay window that looks over the land and beyond, while the formal lounge and dining room are more elegant with cosy plush carpet, bi-fold doors, pendant lighting and lavish window furnishings.
A rumpus room is also on hand, which allows the added bonus of accommodating a pool table or just leave as an extra living room for younger children to hang out. The kitchen has been custom-made and designed with timber cabinetry, a large corner pantry, and double aspect windows from the all-important kitchen sink.
Loads of fruit trees are ready for picking with several varieties of apples, plums, nectarines and apricots, while a good size shed for machinery or vehicles is set amid the acres of home garden and farming land. Whether you are looking to just leave the city lights, or venture to a new lifestyle, this spectacular property will delight anyone looking for quality, style and value. Call our agent today for further details.

1.273HA (3.14 Acres) Multifaceted Period Property in Coveted Location
Situated in an exclusive and well held location only minutes from Ballarat with excellent access to the Western Freeway (1.5 hour to Melbourne CBD), this unique and beautifully maintained period home immediately provides a sense of warmth and privacy. Accommodating two living zones and bedrooms of large proportions, a functional and spacious kitchen meals area with feature (and operational) IXL wood stove, quality natural gas cooking, WIP and abundant bench & cupboard space. Period features that have been carefully retained to include pressed metal ceiling, polished timber floorboards, dado panelling, and wide return veranda. The land features outdoor entertaining amid magnificent traditional cottage gardens, an array of galvanised iron sheds, established orchard and room for some livestock. Additional features include wireless NBN, solar hot water and a 3KW back to grid solar system minimise energy costs. A unique property in a highly convenient location in a setting that you will always adore.

MULTIPLE TOWNSHIP ALLOTMENTS - DEVELOPMENT OR INVESTMENT
Rare and affordable offering, selling as One, Two parcels consisting of Seven separate titles with a total area of approximately 6171M2 (1.52 Acres). Parcel One Six of the allotments (Approx 5564M2 - Allotments 4 to 9 Parish of Amherst) are situated on South side of Ballarat Maryborough Road and are zoned Low Density Residential with mains water connected to allotment 9 and underground mains power pit nearby to the North Western boundary of Allotment 4. Elevated and mainly cleared offer scope for the development of one or possibly two dwellings (STCA). Thrown in as a bonus is a separate title (Allotment 10) situated on the North side of Ballarat Maryborough Road which is approximately 607M2 in size is zoned Rural Living Zone and could be utilised for grazing agistment, long-term land bank investment.

Cosy In Creswick
Homely and low maintenance - two attributes that depict this gorgeous property in down town Creswick!
Positioned to the South of the township and providing an easy run through to Ballarat via the Midland Highway, this property exudes charm right from your very first step inside.
Sitting on a good size 797m2 allotment and providing low level maintenance (especially to the rear), this property provides a gated yard, a small garden shed, a water tank and handy carport to protect your vehicle off the street.
Gas ducted floor heating, plus a split system comfort the home with complete ease, while gleaming timber like floorboards provide a deep base to the neutral wall palette and embellishments within.
Much loved and cared for over the years, this home offers three bedrooms (or two bedrooms with two living rooms), a family bathroom, laundry, kitchen and a semi built in veranda for those sunny days through the colder months.
Beautifully displayed with timber cabinetry and ample bench space, the three point working station through the kitchen is open plan to the dining room and onto the adjoining lounge.
The bathroom has been styled with feature tiles and a splash of colour, which provides a little charm to the room, while the remainder of the home is finished with light colour floor tiles, drapes, blinds and a stylish yet homely décor.
This would be ideal for those looking at retiring to a modest home with enough room to tend to the garden or stroll to the serene surrounds to beautiful Creswick.
Call our agent today for finer details.

Parcel At Front Of Prestige Golf Course Estate
This is a fabulous opportunity to build your dream home at the Goldfields Resort Creswick. The block is situated at the front of the estate looking over wetland, gum trees and the RACV resort. Spacious proportions will please with a fabulous 669m2 and a frontage of 18.59 meters facing north and capturing great natural light into your future home. The first tee is just 100m away, as is the 19th hole with bar, restaurant and delightful views. You don't have to be a golfer to enjoy the resort as there are other attractions such as bird & animal life, walking & mountain bike tracks, tennis courts and BBQ facilities. This lifestyle is had just one hour from Melbourne, three minutes to the hub of Creswick, 20 minutes to Daylesford and ten minutes to Ballarat.

Nestled in the country historic town of Creswick
Creswick has a growing population with bustling shops and a busy cafe culture with a monthly craft and produce market that draws crowds of folk from all around.
3 White Hills Road enjoys the close proximity to the RACV Goldfields Resort offering the full resort experience including golf, dining and spa. The centre of Creswick is just minutes away and you will be in easy reach of heritage towns, spa retreats and wine region.
From the front door you can be straight out on the Midland highway for easy commuting. There is also a bus stop at the end of the road and a local train station in the town.
A front garden of lawn before you enter into the hallway leading into the dining or into the L shaped lounge and family room which has dual aspect to the front looking over open gardens, and looking into your rear garden. With a cosy closed wood effect gas fire.
A modern fitted kitchen, large floor to ceiling pantry style cupboards, dishwasher, electric oven and gas stove, dining area with sliding patio doors in to the rear garden.
With 3 generous size bedrooms each has picture windows with privacy and block out roller blinds. Two bedrooms have built in robes and the master bedroom has a large walk in robe, with a possibility to put an en-suite in place. Double size linen cupboard. The bathroom is original with a separate shower, bath and sink with vanity. Separate laundry with a cupboard, and access to the garden. The property benefits from gas central ducted heating and evaporated cooling.
Outdoors there is a well-established, low maintenance, north oriented garden. A Barbecue alfresco area in a shady west position and a place to sow and grow your own vegetables. There are 2 separate sheds. Being on a corner plot you have access driveways from both White Hills Road and Caddy Drive with a car port in place. With potential if you wanted a garage, subject to council approval.
This property is approximately 18 km North of Ballarat, and 129km Northwest from Melbourne.

Family Entertainer On 6.9 Acres
Feel life's worries slip away as you enter this glorious three hectare property just on the outskirts of Central Creswick. Extremely usable, with slight elevation to benefit the views, this property (set on three titles) could be suitable for hobby farming, equestrian activities or create your own motocross course amid an attractive rural setting.
With spectacular views across the treetops, this private property (just off Ascot Creswick Road) offers great accommodation with four good size bedrooms, two bathrooms, a study, a capacious living area and a seamless amalgamation between the dining zone and gourmet timber kitchen.
Perfectly arranged to create easy operation, the kitchen offers mountains of storage along with a lovely open design to enjoy the chefs company whilst cooking or preparing the meals. Comforted by a free standing wood heater and decorated with warm whites and a splash of colour, this home is a comfortable hideaway with all the bells and whistles required for todays living.
Sliding doors takes you to the wide verandas that surround three quarters of the home, while also providing exceptional views of the natural bushland virtually on your doorstep. A feature dam and a running creek create aesthetic ornamentation amongst the majestic gums, while a 100 year old apple tree and various fruit trees add a little self sufficiency to the land.
Further highlights of this elevated hardiplank home include polished hardwood floors, block out window furnishings and sun filled spaces, while outdoors offers a double bay shed and a double carport to protect your vehicles or garden implements.
Call our agent, take a tour and even sneak a delicious nectarine from their prolific orchard.

Immaculate 2 Bedroom Unit
Less house, yet more HOME, thats what you get with this fabulous unit in the whisper quiet neighbourhood of downtown Creswick.
Perfectly suited to retirees with no steps, bathroom handrails and low maintenance garden, this great little two bedroom unit is located within an uncluttered complex, just moments from Clunes Road, where public transport is available to access the towns centre or onto Ballarat (also within walking distance from the shops).
Ducted heating plus a strategically placed split system comforts the home with complete ease, while the freshly painted interior ensures there is little to do for many years to come. Quality drapes help insulate the rooms, while the neutral tones and existing cabinetry provide an easy foundation and palette to work with when decorating.
Two bedrooms offer built in robes, with a functional bathroom and independent laundry adding a serviceable floorplan for more than one. The kitchen offers a three point working station, while the defined dining area and living area all work well together. The rear yard could is nice and flat with a concrete path leading onto a little grassed area to rest in sun.
Finished with cosy carpet, vinyl flooring and feature tiles, this home provides retirees, first home buyers, investors or those looking to downsize an opportunity to live independently with little to worry about.
Connected to natural gas and offering NBN advantages ( back up battery), this property provides a lock up garage and extra car space, which certainly provides a tidy option if considering your next step in life.

Scenic Views with Acerage
Situated in peaceful Red Lion on approx 15 acres is this three bedroom property. The hebel brick home is surrounded by a 3m return verandah with scenic views of the Pyrenees Ranges. Featuring 9.3 ceilings through out, the spacious main living area is open plan and consists of dining, lounge and a country style kitchen with jarrah wood benches, ample cupboards and gas cooking. All three bedrooms are of good size and feature built in robes. The central bathroom boasts a large shower, bath and vanity, while the laundry has a double trough and separate toilet. In winter the wood fire is the perfect place to cosy up in front of and enjoy the scenery. Part of the verandah has been covered in to create a lovely sun room with raised veggie gardens at your front door. The property is broken up into approx 5 paddocks with good fencing, animal shelters, large dam, water tanks, 2 orchards with over 60 trees, chicken coop, dog runs and shedding with concrete floor, shelving and power. All of this just 10 minutes from Maryborough.

Luxury Lifestyle To Be Had In Golf Course Resort
This perfectly position allotment is found towards the front of the RACV Goldfields Resort. The locale grants those who reside splendid views over the 1st Tee, the 9th Green, two fairways, bunkers, the practice green and back to the club house/nineteenth hole with its bar, restaurant and balcony looking over the resort. Set in a quiet court the block measures 537m2. It has a frontage of 19.3m and the rear is 25m. Although you could look to build your dream home, there are also plans available for two luxury dwellings to fit the parcel. The lifestyle granted by the estate include bush walking, mountain bike tracks, birdlife, kangaroos, tennis courts, BBQ area, fine dining and the Creswick hub is just three minutes away, Ballarat is ten and Daylesford is approximately ½ an hour away. You may choose to build a full time residence or maybe it's a weekender, but either a way your life will be enriched.

Stunning Family Home In Kingston
Large proportions, stylish fixtures, and filled with natural light, this sprawling home in the gorgeous rural township of Kingston offers every bit of relaxed living spaces both inside and out. Just off the Midland Highway, 10 mins from Creswick and 25 minutes to Ballarat, this property will delight all members of the family. Situated on an approx. 3994m2 allotment, with a large three bay shed with power and mechanics pit, manicured gardens with a prolific walnut and lemon tree as well as an enclosed back yard with a freestanding two storey cubby house and swing set, perfect for childrens play. Now that is just outdoors!
Step inside the JG King steel frame brick construction and be enthralled with the quality and finish of this neat and tidy three bedroom home. The master suite is pampered by a walk through robe, ceiling fan and an extra-large convenient ensuite whilst the two remaining bedrooms feature built in robes. A study nook is tucked away (European style) in the entrance with NBN connection which alleviates room for the more important dual living zones.
Filled with natural light from the floor to ceiling bay windows and are warmed by a strategically placed split system and freestanding wood heater, these areas offer commodious proportions that could bring the entire community and /or family together in one. The kitchen has been dressed with high quality Meile appliances, a three point working triangle and wide open preparation benches,(which could easy double as a fabulous homework point for children) while the adjoining meals area and family room provide a compatible connection with the working chef. A family bathroom, independent laundry with storage and a separate toilet add to the balance of the grooming areas, while the overall design is perfectly suitable for growing families.
Finished with wide return verandas, an attached double lock up garage and a magnificent rural outlook, this property is a beautiful display of a stylish country abode; Kingston within metres. Call today for further details.

Superb Value in the Heart of Town
Located within walking distance to all Creswick has to offer, this home presents exceptional value for money! Ideal as a first home, investment (currently tenanted until May 2018 at $260 per week) or for retirees wanting to downsize, offering a very low maintenance allotment of approximately 333 m2.
The home itself is in a complex of two homes, separately titled and only 7 years young. A convenient split system is located in the family area for year round comfort, with lovely bamboo flooring to match any decor.
The incredibly large kitchen provides room to move freely with plenty of bench space and cabinetry and is open plan to the family living area for all inclusive family moments.
Offering 2 full sized bedrooms with new carpet; a fresh, neat bathroom with separate toilet, good sized laundry and fully fenced rear yard, this home is perfect for those wishing to live a hassle free lifestyle.
The single garage is currently used as a second living area, but could easily be converted back to house a vehicle.
Call our agent today for an inspection.

Re-carpet, Re-paint and Retire!
Easy care brick veneer on a compact corner allotment of 337sqm with a delightful country outlook within close proximity of the many wonderful amenities provided in the picturesque Creswick township. Perfect for a single person or couple, this 1 bedroom cottage has quite new kitchen joinery, Rinnai energy saver gas heater and "infinity" gas hot water, separate laundry, spacious bathroom and a wonderful aspect to the living space. Timber deck overlooks the rear garden, and the spacious single garage has power and light. New floorcoverings and maybe a coat of paint, and you have very affordable living for many years to come. Be quick to inspect this beauty.

Timeless Homestead Offering Modern Style Living
Sweeping driveway, wide verandas and vast spaces set on 1 acre, thats whats on offer in the beautiful country community of Kingston.
Nestled in the heart of the town and just 10 minutes from Creswick, 15 minutes to Daylesford and 25 minutes to Ballarat, this stylish recycled red brick property delivers a peaceful lifestyle along with calming uninterrupted views of both east and west aspects across the extended countryside.
Beautiful established trees grace the manicured gardens, which proudly feature trimmed hedges, tiered garden beds to the front and a wraparound verandah serviced by French doors, all creating a grand entrance to the home. The rear secure yard is a haven for childs play and leisure alike, complete with an enormous adventure playground, cubby house and open space. Ideal for entertaining or relaxing, the alfresco zone complete with merbau timber decking is accessed via large stacking doors.
Car accommodation includes an oversized double carport and 4 car garage of approximately 192sqm currently with part set up to be the ultimate man cave with built in bar, workshop and loads of storage.
This luxurious country home includes; incredible spotted gum flooring, wide hallway, four king-size bedrooms all with BIRs (including a grand master complete with ensuite & massive WIR), two separate living areas are serviced by a two-way wood fire, along with a radiant family bathroom, powder room, a generous laundry with loads of storage & bench space and much more.
The kitchen, dining and family area is one capacious room which creates an outstanding open plan zone for everyday living, with gleaming kitchen appliances including a 900mm stainless steel cooker and rangehood, stone benchtops, island bench with industrial lighting and loads of light filtering through.
The décor and finishes throughout this home are impeccable, with subtle textures and palette which are enhanced by contemporary lighting, slimline window furnishings and cosy carpet.
Kingston is well known for its rolling hills, magnificent Avenue of Honour of Elm trees and community spirit. Arrange a viewing by calling our agent asap! It is the complete package, you will be impressed.

Neat As A Pin In Great Location With Fabulous Views
This property offers position, panorama, presentation and price. Situated just moments from all the local amenities and facilities of Creswick, this generous 855m2 allotment is ideal for those looking for a little serenity with loads to offer in your very own backyard.
Fully renovated with a sparkling new stainless steel and timber kitchen, new floor coverings and window furnishings, this three bedroom home offers a perfect floorplan with an open plan living area, dining zone and a full width veranda to sit and absorb the land and ponder life.
Comfortably warmed by hydronic heating and supplemented by a strategically placed split system, this Steel cladded home has been freshly painted, has been fully insulated through the roof and floors and has natural gas & NBN connection.
Extra value has been added through the massive garage and workshop to the rear. Built specifically for a home handy man or tradesperson, this large zone has been fully concreted and is accessible virtually from the rear of the home.
Further to this, there is a covered zone for further storage or vehicle cover and an extra space to entertain friends and family outdoors. Prolific fruit trees sit amid the dedicated vegetable plots, while there is plenty of room and tank water (approx. 27,000 litres) to add to your landscaping talent or enhance the distant views across the sloping block.
This is a value packed home for all members of the family. Call today for a private inspection and further details.

Brilliant farming/lifestyle close to Daylesford/Blampied
"Eastern Slopes" - 416 acres over 2 lots
Situated just 15 minutes from Daylesford, 25 minutes to Ballarat, and 90 mins from Melbourne is this attractive property with productive pastures and a mix of flat to undulating landscape.
The property can be purchased as a whole or separately, as follows:
Lot 1 - Homestead and 312 ac (126.3ha)
Ideally suited to livestock/grazing/equine enterprise, this versatile and diverse property has a range of country the from rich volcanic ground to undulating and picturesque grazing hills, leading down to direct access to Wombat State Forest.
The property is well fenced into 10 main paddocks and has 3 dams, has a bore connected to stock troughs which also service the gardens and house utility water, and has frontage to the spring fed McLachlan Creek.
The 3BR + study brick homestead has lovely views to volcanic hills in the west and state forest to the east. The well maintained home has an expansive dining-kitchen area, separate lounge, internal access from double garage to separate laundry, shower & toilet.
Structural improvements include 2 haysheds, 3-stand shearing shed (3 phase power) with wool press, adjoining yards. There is also an old wool shed/storage plus separate machinery shed/garaging.
Lot 2 - 104 ac (42.46ha)
With several outstanding potential home sites (STCA) this corner allotment would make the ultimate lifestyle property.
The property has a catchment dam and is fenced into one main paddock, and adjoins Lot 1.
For Sale by Expression of Interest
Closes: Thursday 8th June, 2017 at 2pm
For EOI documentation and inspection contact agent.

Where Luxury, Tranquillity and Lifestyle Meet - This is Living
This stunning near new home has been built to exacting standards with quality, class and sophistication in mind. Positioned to perfection on a gorgeous 1 and a 1/4 acre allotment the home itself features 3 large bedrooms, the master a king size retreat with massive en suite, stunning free standing bath and separate shower. The open plan kitchen, meals living area is exquisite and features electric induction cooktop, duel oven, dishwasher and butler's pantry. Everywhere looks out onto something here and the peaceful tranquillity these magnificent grounds have to offer are simply stunning with regular visits from our native wildlife including kangaroos, koalas, magnificent birdlife and even the resident echidna. Outside incorporates a sensational outdoor alfresco area overlooking the gorgeous garden surrounds and beautiful natural flora and fauna. Features include a 5.1kw solar electricity system (approx. 26 panels), central heating and refrigerated cooling & ducted vacuuming throughout, double carport and massive 9x12 garage with home office and man cave including pot belly, shower and toilet - the ideal space to entertain with family and friends. Including American oak flooring, 45,000 litre water tank, town water, NBN and surround sound both inside and out this is a home you'll never want to leave. Situated just 5 mins from the Creswick town centre and 20 minutes from the Ballarat CBD this fringe property is positioned to perfection and a real retreat for those looking for peace and tranquillity yet coupled together with modern day conveniences one has come to expect. A real surprise package from front to back, both inside and out - this home is sure to impress so call now to book your private viewing today.
